intro: Neoalsomitra pilosa, commonly known as the hairy neoalsomitra, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. The fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, typical of the Rubiaceae family.
